attributes.value: 9-Inch Round Cake Pans:  You will need three 9-inch round cake pans to bake the cake layers. If you don't have three, you can bake the layers in batches. Mixing Bowls:  A few mixing bowls will be necessary for preparing the cake batter, whipping the cream, and mixing other ingredients. Electric Mixer or Stand Mixer:  An electric mixer or stand mixer will be very helpful for beating the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy, as well as whipping the heavy cream. Spatula:  A spatula will be useful for folding the dry ingredients into the egg mixture and spreading the jam and whipped cream layers. Sifter:  A sifter will be needed to sift the flour, potato starch, and baking powder together to ensure a light and fluffy cake texture. Wire Rack:  A wire rack will help cool the cake layers evenly after they come out of the oven. Cake Stand or Serving Plate:  A cake stand or large serving plate is useful for assembling and presenting the finished cake. Offset Spatula:  An offset spatula can be helpful for spreading the whipped cream evenly over the cake layers and for smoothing the sides of the cake. Piping Bag and Tips (Optional):  If you want to decorate the cake with whipped cream in decorative patterns, a piping bag and tips will be useful. Rolling Pin (Optional):  If you choose to use marzipan to cover the cake or create decorative shapes, a rolling pin will be needed.

9-Inch Round Cake Pans:  You will need three 9-inch round cake pans to bake the cake layers. If you don't have three, you can bake the layers in batches. Mixing Bowls:  A few mixing bowls will be necessary for preparing the cake batter, whipping the cream, and mixing other ingredients. Electric Mixer or Stand Mixer:  An electric mixer or stand mixer will be very helpful for beating the eggs and sugar until light and fluffy, as well as whipping the heavy cream. Spatula:  A spatula will be useful for folding the dry ingredients into the egg mixture and spreading the jam and whipped cream layers. Sifter:  A sifter will be needed to sift the flour, potato starch, and baking powder together to ensure a light and fluffy cake texture. Wire Rack:  A wire rack will help cool the cake layers evenly after they come out of the oven. Cake Stand or Serving Plate:  A cake stand or large serving plate is useful for assembling and presenting the finished cake. Offset Spatula:  An offset spatula can be helpful for spreading the whipped cream evenly over the cake layers and for smoothing the sides of the cake. Piping Bag and Tips (Optional):  If you want to decorate the cake with whipped cream in decorative patterns, a piping bag and tips will be useful. Rolling Pin (Optional):  If you choose to use marzipan to cover the cake or create decorative shapes, a rolling pin will be needed.

Instructions:

Prepare the Cake Layers:

Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour three 9-inch round cake pans.

In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar together until light and fluffy.

Sift the flour, potato starch, and baking powder together.
Gently fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture until well combined.

Divide the batter evenly among the prepared cake pans.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Allow the cake layers to cool in the pans for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Prepare the Filling and Topping:

In a large bowl, whip the heavy cream with the powdered sugar and vanilla extract until stiff peaks form.

(If desired, fold in sliced fresh strawberries.)

Assemble the Cake:

Place one cake layer on a serving plate.
Spread a layer of strawberry jam over the cake, followed by a layer of whipped cream.

Repeat with the remaining cake layers, jam, and whipped cream.
Spread a final layer of whipped cream over the top and sides of the cake.

Decorate:

Decorate the cake with sprinkles, grated chocolate, or additional fresh strawberries.

Optionally, roll out marzipan and use it to cover the cake or create decorative shapes.

Serve:

Refrigerate the cake for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

Serve chilled and enjoy!
